Image interpolation

Image interpolation documentation

Installation

To install Image interpolation, run this command in your terminal:

   $ poetry install

Usage

Run the interpolation CLI with:

poetry run interpolation

To see available commands, use:

poetry run interpolation --help

Select the required command inside cli/.

Example

To perform bilinear interpolation on an image, use the following command:

poetry run interpolation image-interpolate lantern.jpeg lantern1.jpeg 500 1000 -f

Explanation:

Parameter

Description

poetry run

Runs a script defined in pyproject.toml using Poetry.

interpolation

The main command for running interpolation-related tasks.

image-interpolate

A specific subcommand for performing bilinear image interpolation.

image.jpeg

The input image file that will be resized.

interpolated_image.jpeg

The output file where the interpolated image will be saved.

500

The target width (in pixels) for the output image.

1000

The target height (in pixels) for the output image.

-f

Forces overwriting of the output file if it already exists.

This command resizes image.jpeg to 500x1000 pixels using bilinear interpolation and saves the result as interpolated_image.jpeg.
